ginterval.io module¶

class ginterval.io.ShiftLoader(path, fmt=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The reference and shift bed files must bed sorted by bedtools sort.

Or use command: sort -k1,1 -k2,2n

The sorted results of igvtools is not supported.

get_shifts(reference, extend=0)[source]¶

Module contents¶

GInterval object represent a interval on the genomic coordination. It can consist many blocks (smaller interval which only contain x and y value). Additional information, such as chromosome, name and strand, are also contained in the GInterval objects.

class ginterval.GInterval(x=None, y=None, blocks=None, thick=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

GInterval is the basic element interval represent a range of genomic.

x¶

int – The start position (0-base, included) of the interval.

y¶

int – The end position (0-base, excluded) of the interval.

chrom¶

str – The chromosome on which the interval is located.

name¶

str – The name of the interval.

strand¶

str – The value is “+” or “-“.

forward¶

boolean – True when the strand is “+”.

reverse¶

boolean – True when the strand is “-“.

Examples

Create a GInterval instance before any operation:

g = GInterval(10, 20)

g = GInterval(blocks=[10, 20, 30, 40])

block_count¶
blocks¶
center_index¶

return – The index of the strand-specific center genomic position. Blocks and Gaps are considered.

center_position¶

return – The center genomic position of this GInterval instance. Blocks and Gaps are considered.

The other block interval is a continuous subset of self. :param adjacent1: :param adjacent2: :param other: :return:

Combine the adjacent blocks to one block. :param blocks: the list of sorted blocks. :return:

contain(other)[source]¶

The bases of other are all in self block intervals. :param other: :return:

return – The strand-specific index of end genomic position (0-base).

return – The strand-specific end genomic position (0-base, included).

forward

return – True when the strand equal to “+”

Returns:True when there is a thick interval in this GInterval instance.

The 0-base and strand-specific index correspond to specific position. :param position: :return:

The overlap of GInterval without blocks considered. :param other: :return:

static sorted_blocks(blocks)[source]¶

Input a iterator of blocks and return the sorted iterator. Sorted by x position. :param blocks: :return:

start_index¶

return – The strand-specific index of start genomic position (0-base).

start_position¶

return – The strand-specific start genomic position (0-base, included).

strand

return – The strand information of GInterval instance “+” or “-“. Default “+”

thick¶
thick_end_index¶

return – The index of the genomic end position of thick relative to GInterval instance. (0-base)

thick_end_position¶

return – The genomic end position of thick interval. (0-base, included)

thick_start_index¶

return – The index of the genomic start position of thick relative to GInterval instance. (0-base)

thick_start_position¶

return – The genomic start position of thick interval. (0-base, included)

to_bed_format_string(ncol=12)[source]¶
x

return – The x position (0-base included) of the interval instance.

y

return – The y position (0-base excluded) of the interval instance.
